briefdescription.para: No filtering. Return all results.

detaileddescription.para:
Return only unique (distinct) values.
Not implemented

Return a sample of the given size.
Not implemented

Return datapoints that are included in the range.
Not implemented

Return datapoints that are not included in the range.
Not implemented

briefdescription.para: Filter for a given time interval.
The first (earliest) data point.
The last (latest) data point.
The data point with the smallest value.
The data point with the largest value.
The arithmetic mean (average).
The harmonic mean.
The geometric mean.
The quadratic mean (root mean squaer).
The number of data points.
The sum of values.
The sum of squares of values.
The difference between the maximum value and the minimum value.
The sample variance.
The sample standard deviation.
The population variance.
The population standard deviation.
The value with the smallest absolute value.
The value with the largest absolute value.
The product.
The skewness (shape parameter).
The kurtosis (shape parameter).
Types of aggregations that can be computed on a time series.
Column of numeric values.
Column of binary data.
Types of time series columns.
Filter for a given time interval.
Types of aggregations that can be computed on a time series.
Aggregation input and result for columns of numeric values.
Aggregation input and result for columns of blobs.
Types of time series columns.
Description of a time series column.
An opaque local table structure used for bulk insertions.

memberdef.argsstring: (qdb_handle_t handle, const char *alias, const qdb_ts_column_info_t *columns, qdb_size_t column_count)
memberdef.name: qdb_ts_create

briefdescription.para: Creates a time series.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null-terminated UTF-8 string representing the alias of the time series.
An array of column descriptions that are to be added to the time series.
The number of columns to add.

briefdescription.para: Returns all the columns of a time series.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null-terminated UTF-8 string representing the alias of the time series.
A pointer to an array that will contain descriptions of columns present in the time series.
A pointer to an integer that will receive the number of columns.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.
This function is still under development. Performance and compatibility are not guaranteed.

memberdef.argsstring: (qdb_handle_t handle, const char *alias, const char *column, const qdb_ts_double_point *values, qdb_size_t count)
memberdef.name: qdb_ts_double_insert

briefdescription.para: Inserts points in a time series.

detaileddescription.para: Time series are distributed across the cluster and support efficient insertion anywhere within the time series as well as efficient lookup based on time.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null-terminated UTF-8 string representing the alias of the time series.
A pointer to a null-terminated UTF-8 string representing the name of the column to work on.
An array of data points to be inserted.
The number of data points to insert.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.
This function is still under development. Performance and compatibility are not guaranteed.

memberdef.argsstring: (qdb_handle_t handle, const char *alias, const char *column, const qdb_ts_filtered_range_t *ranges, qdb_size_t range_count, qdb_ts_double_point **points, qdb_size_t *point_count)
memberdef.name: qdb_ts_double_get_ranges

briefdescription.para: Retrieves doubles in the specified range of the time series column.

detaileddescription.para: It is an error to call this function on a non existing time series.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null-terminated UTF-8 string representing the alias of the time series.
A pointer to a null-terminated UTF-8 string representing the name of the column to work on.
An array of ranges (intervals) for which data should be retrieved.
The number of ranges.
A pointer to an array that will contain data points from all given ranges.
A pointer to an integer that will receive the number of returned points.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.
This function is still under development. Performance and compatibility are not guaranteed.

memberdef.argsstring: (qdb_handle_t handle, const char *alias, const char *column, qdb_ts_double_aggregation_t *aggregations, qdb_size_t aggregation_count)
memberdef.name: qdb_ts_double_aggregate

briefdescription.para: Aggregate a sub-part of the double column of the time series.

detaileddescription.para: It is an error to call this function on a non existing time series.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null-terminated UTF-8 string representing the alias of the time series.
A pointer to a null-terminated UTF-8 string representing the name of the column to work on.
An array of structures representing the aggregations to compute and their results.
The number of elements in the aggregations array.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.
This function is still under development. Performance and compatibility are not guaranteed.

memberdef.argsstring: (qdb_handle_t handle, const char *alias, const char *column, qdb_ts_blob_aggregation_t *aggregations, qdb_size_t aggregation_count)
memberdef.name: qdb_ts_blob_aggregate

briefdescription.para: Aggregate a sub-part of a blob column of the time series.

detaileddescription.para: It is an error to call this function on a non existing time series.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null-terminated UTF-8 string representing the alias of the time series.
A pointer to a null-terminated UTF-8 string representing the name of the column to work on.
An array of structures representing the aggregations to compute and their results.
The number of elements in the aggregations array.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.
This function is still under development. Performance and compatibility are not guaranteed.

memberdef.argsstring: (qdb_handle_t handle, const char *alias, const char *column, const qdb_ts_blob_point *values, qdb_size_t count)

briefdescription.para: Inserts blob in a time series column.

detaileddescription.para: It is an error to call this function on a non existing time series.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null-terminated UTF-8 string representing the alias of the time series.
A pointer to a null-terminated UTF-8 string representing the name of the column to work on.
An array of data points to be inserted.
The number of data points to insert.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.
This function is still under development. Performance and compatibility are not guaranteed.

memberdef.name: qdb_ts_blob_get_ranges

briefdescription.para: Retrieves blobs in the specified range of the time series column.

detaileddescription.para: It is an error to call this function on a non existing time series.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null-terminated UTF-8 string representing the alias of the time series.
A pointer to a null-terminated UTF-8 string representing the name of the column to work on.
An array of ranges (intervals) for which data should be retrieved.
The number of ranges.
A pointer to an array that will contain data points from all given ranges.
A pointer to an integer that will receive the number of returned points.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.

memberdef.name: qdb_ts_erase_ranges

briefdescription.para: Erase all points in the specified range (left inclusive).

detaileddescription.para: It is an error to call this function on a non existing time series.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null-terminated UTF-8 string representing the alias of the time series.
A pointer to a null-terminated UTF-8 string representing the name of the column to work on.
An array of ranges (intervals) for which data should be erased.
The number of ranges.
A pointer to an integer that will receive the number of erased points.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.
This function is still under development. Performance and compatibility are not guaranteed.

memberdef.argsstring: (qdb_handle_t handle, const char *alias, const qdb_ts_column_info_t *columns, qdb_size_t column_count, qdb_local_table_t *table)
memberdef.name: qdb_ts_local_table_init

briefdescription.para: Initialize a local table for bulk insertion in time series.

detaileddescription.para: It is an error to call this function on a non existing time series.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null-terminated UTF-8 string representing the alias of the time series.
An array of column descriptions to which data will be inserted.
The number of columns.
A pointer to a local table that will be initialized if the function returns successfully.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.
This function is still under development. Performance and compatibility are not guaranteed.

briefdescription.para: Set a value in the current row in a column of doubles indicated by the given index.

parameterdescription.para: A valid local table previously initialized by qdb_ts_local_table_init.
A zero-based index of the column in which the value should be set. The index is based on the order of columns in the call to qdb_ts_local_table_init used to initialize table.
A value to be set in the chosen column in the current row.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.
This function is still under development. Performance and compatibility are not guaranteed.

memberdef.argsstring: (qdb_local_table_t table, qdb_size_t column_index, const void *content, qdb_size_t content_length)
memberdef.name: qdb_ts_row_set_blob

briefdescription.para: Set a value in the current row in a column of blobs indicated by the given index, copy data.

detaileddescription.para: The data will be copied and kept alive until the following qdb_ts_push call returns.

parameterdescription.para: A valid local table previously initialized by qdb_ts_local_table_init.
A zero-based index of the column in which the value should be set. The index is based on the order of columns in the call to qdb_ts_local_table_init used to initialize table.
A pointer to the data to be set in the chosen column in the current row.
Length, in bytes, of the data pointed to by content.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.
This function is still under development. Performance and compatibility are not guaranteed.

memberdef.argsstring: (qdb_local_table_t table, qdb_size_t column_index, const void *content, qdb_size_t content_length)
memberdef.name: qdb_ts_row_set_blob_no_copy

briefdescription.para: Set a value in the current row in a column of blobs indicated by the given index without copying data.

detaileddescription.para: The data will NOT be copied and the user must ensure that the buffer pointed by content is kept alive until the end of the corresponding call to qdb_ts_push.

parameterdescription.para: A valid local table previously initialized by qdb_ts_local_table_init.
A zero-based index of the column in which the value should be set. The index is based on the order of columns in the call to qdb_ts_local_table_init used to initialize table.
A pointer to the data to be set in the chosen column in the current row. The pointed data must be kept alive until the following qdb_ts_push call returns.
Length, in bytes, of the data pointed to by content.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.
The data pointed to by content must be kept alive until the following qdb_ts_push call returns.
This function is still under development. Performance and compatibility are not guaranteed.

briefdescription.para: Append current row to the outcoming data buffer.

parameterdescription.para: A valid local table previously initialized by qdb_ts_local_table_init.
The timestamp of all data points in the row to append.
A pointer to an integer that will receive the index of the currently appended row. The index is counted since the call to qdb_ts_local_table_init. The pointer may be null.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.
This function is still under development. Performance and compatibility are not guaranteed.

briefdescription.para: Push all the appended rows to the database.

detaileddescription.para: All the rows that were appended using qdb_ts_table_row_append since the last call to qdb_ts_push or qdb_ts_local_table_init will be pushed.

parameterdescription.para: A valid local table previously initialized by qdb_ts_local_table_init.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.
This function is still under development. Performance and compatibility are not guaranteed.
Time series are under development. Performance and compatibility are not guaranteed.
